title: Siemens expands sustainable MV switchgear range - Your Gateway to Power Transmission & Distribution - T&D India
summary: Siemens has expanded its sustainable medium-voltage switchgear range with the introduction of the F-gas-free blue GIS primary switchgear, supporting decarbonization efforts. The new switchgear, based on the Robust Eco Design concept, ensures a reduced carbon footprint throughout its life cycle. Furthermore, enhancements to the NXPLUS C24 allow for climate-neutral energy distribution and efficient predictive maintenance through digital integration. Siemens is also investing in green manufacturing processes at their Frankfurt-Fechenheim site to meet growing demand.
green_innovation: TRUE: The innovations described contribute to environmental sustainability by reducing carbon emissions, utilizing clean air for insulation, and minimizing harmful environmental impacts throughout their manufacturing and operational life cycles.
business_innovation: TRUE: The expansion of Siemens' product range and enhancements to existing products represent significantly improved business processes that differ from previous offerings, as they focus on sustainability and efficiency.
green_product: TRUE: The new blue GIS switchgear qualifies as a green product because it is designed to have a reduced environmental impact, utilizes sustainable materials, and supports energy distribution with a low carbon footprint.
green_process: TRUE: The manufacturing and operational processes involved in creating the blue GIS switchgear are green processes as they minimize waste, conserve energy, and rely on sustainable practices such as using green electricity and reducing landfill waste.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334410 - Semiconductor and Other Electronic Component Manufacturing, 335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing, 332999 - All Other Miscellaneous Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing, 423690 - Other Electronic Parts and Equipment Merchant Wholesalers.
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not exhibit signs of greenwashing as it provides credible information about the sustainable features and environmental benefits of Siemens' products, backed by investments in green manufacturing processes.
